title: Graduate Student Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Park University in Feb 2023
Interview Descriptions: Applied online and received a virtual interview invite pretty quickly. Then was told they would get back to me no matter what the decision was. Instead, they completely ghosted me and I haven't heard from them in over a month
Interview Questions: How does your previous experience align with the position?

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Park University
Interview Descriptions: Graduate assistant interviews are conducted by each individual department within the university that one applies for. I applied for the Social Work department and International Education. The SW department contacted me within a couple weeks to set up a zoom interview with their program director. International education called me sometime after I completed the SW interview and set up a phone interview with 3 of their team members. Both interviews lasted about a half hour.
Interview Questions:
Q: Tell me about yourself. 

Q: How would you promote an event on campus?

Q: Tell me about any experience you have with research.

title: Campus Center Coach Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Park University (Boston, MA) in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions: Online, very thorough. Spoke with hiring mananger and her boss. Opportunity for asking and answering questions allowed. Prompt with decision. HR is on top of things in terms of paperwork and training.
Interview Questions: Why did I want to work at this university

title: Student Success Coach Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Park University (Gilbert, AZ) in Nov 2020
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview- After my first interview I got a call back to interview in the next step but I asked pay before schedule the interview and politely declined based off of the salary. There would’ve been multiple in person interviews afterwards.
Interview Questions: asked about my work experience, asked very specific questions in regards to how I would handle things. How I define success, how I would measure success with students. Also the generic questions of a time when I felt the most proud, etc.

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Park University (Kansas City, MO) in Oct 2019
Interview Descriptions: Very fast, have many people. The interview is a big opportunity for me. I little nervous because of my first experience but I passed on to the job. I declined in the end because I am an international student and I went to my country  (COVID)
Interview Questions: I don't remember a specific question, maybe talking about you?

title: Financial Aid Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Park University (Parkville, MO) in May 2019
Interview Descriptions: Moved very quickly. Started with a phone fall and had an offer by the end of the week. The in person interview was quick. Consisted of Director and associate directors. Did not meet any staff or future coworkers.
Interview Questions: Experience working with a difficult student

title: Social Media Marketing Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Park University (Parkville, MO) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: It was a very typical interview. We went over my resume, and he asked me how comfortable I felt with performing the tasks that were expected of the job. He asked to see some of my past work from my profile.
Interview Questions: What is your availability, and what kind of camera do you use?

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Park University (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: Interview with a multi person search committee. Why was I interested in the position. Experience working with Military,  adult students etc. I was asked my leadership style and to describe my first 90 days in office.
Interview Questions: why are you interested in Park University?

title: Financial Aid Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Park University in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: Interview went well and both interviews were Associate Directors. Was shown around the department and had a brief (very brief) tour of a small part of campus. It overall was good (panel style) but I would have liked to see more of campus and gotten a longer tour.
Interview Questions: What is your idea of customer service?

title: Admissions Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 7 weeks. I interviewed at Park University (Kansas City, MO)
Interview Descriptions: The interview was in a typical style. The first interview was over the phone and held with three people within the department. They asked me about myself as well as my experiences in other jobs. The next interview was held in person at the school with several people from the department. Each one asked questions about my experiences and typical interview questions. Everyone was really nice and welcoming.
Interview Questions: They asked me to describe in detail how to make a peanut butter sandwich.

title: Assist Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Park University (Kansas City, MO) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: You talk with groups of people and do a teaching presentation - like anyplace else.  Easy process - have fun doing it.  Questions about your teaching and online work (LMS), research, and service work.  Goals...
Interview Questions: What can you teach?  Will need to do teach research and service work.

title: Head Coach Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Park University (Parkville, MO) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: I got a call from AD weeks after I thought the job was probably filled. We talked for awhile and then I came on campus for an interview with other coaches.
Interview Questions: Tell us about yourself. Strengths weaknesses. Recruiting ties in Kansas City.

title: Adjunct Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Park University
Interview Descriptions: Quick phone interview then 8 week training course. Interview was professional and cordial.  Interviewer answered all my questions as well, so it was good going back and forth in the process.  The training process was described in detail. Guaranteed to get first semester after training to work, then after that, as needed basis.
Interview Questions: Questioned how I would handle various worldviews

title: Academic Support Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Park University
Interview Descriptions: I initially applied online by submitting my resume to HR.  I was called back a few weeks later to schedule an interview.  I was notified that my references would also be contacted during the same week as my interview.  The actual interview consisted of a panel of 3 people. Typical interview questions. Very inviting environment.
Interview Questions: How comfortable are you working with demanding customers (internal or external)?

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Park University
Interview Descriptions: No Hiring or interviewing process. None what so ever. For student workers they will accept any and all. It was quite crazy. and I mean crazy. No over sight, no work. Just sit down and get paid to be yelled at for not doing a job that no one told you to do.
Interview Questions: There were none.

title: Administration Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Park University
Interview Descriptions:
I was contacted by Park University shortly after applying online. They conducted a phone interview with me and then proceeded with an on-site interview the following week. The position only required a HS Diploma and 1-2 years of experience. Well, I have a college degree in Technical Writing and was looking for beginner work while taking some Grad classes. However, I was more than qualified for the position. 

When I walked into the Admin. Office, all of the employees were middle-aged and older women. I could automatically tell that there was a "click" type atmosphere in the office. The interview itself went well. Typical interview, but we just sat around in a circle with no table inside a small personal office (odd). 

A week after my interview I was called and told that I was not selected for the position. This was a shock, but after reading other reviews of the college on Glassdoor, I knew why I was not selected. Turns out they hired another middle-aged woman to fit in with their group. It didn't seem like the office liked change or competition of any kind.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Lab Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Park University (Parkville, MO) in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: All of the science department facility were present in the interview. Each one of them asked me questions pertaining their field of study. There was a chemist, biochemistry, anatomy, zoology, and physic teacher--they asked one question.
Interview Questions: There are 20 amino acids, name 5?

title: Work Study Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Park University (Parkville, MO) in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions: On the day of the interview I had to take a computer typing test and pass with a 75%. The test was based on grammar, spelling and how many words you could type in 5-10 minutes. I passed after one attempt. Im sure if you were a nice person they would let you attempt the test twice. The interview after that was quick and simple.
Interview Questions: What computer skills do you have?

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Park University (Kansas City, MO) in Jun 2012
Interview Descriptions: started with a phone interview then an invitation to the school
Interview Questions: N/A
